name: Waterfront Cebu City Hotel & Casino

reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights in March for business.
reviews.title: Good Hotel in Cebu

reviews.text: The hotel is huge with busy casino and exhibition. Room is average. Breakfast has adequate choices.
reviews.title: Comfort & Good Service. Great Location.

reviews.text: Location is a bit far away from city, but no problem as taxi is all around.
reviews.title: The best Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for vacation. I booked our room through hotels.com, got our Deluxe Room w/ breakfast for only ($70). I think it's a good deal.
reviews.title: A Happy Mother’s Birthday Gift

reviews.text: Room was comfortable & clean. I didn't pay the Php 1,000 deposit for the ref & mini-bar, so staff had to lock the fridge.(Buy food from outised instead, it's cheaper.) They have 2 bottles of complimentary bottled water, coffee powder etc.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay, had a great time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiancé and I stayed here and we loved it. The weather wasn't great so we couldn't take advantage of the pool but everything in the hotel was great. The hotel is very close to the mall and other restaurants. The Breakfast Buffet was excellent and the restaurants were all good. Everyone at the hotel was very nice and all very helpful. We had a very nice guy named Allen who cleaned our room and was always there to help with anything we needed. Even the casino was great as I won some money there...:). Our overall experience was awesome and we would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first visit to this hotel as a guest and as the taxi pulled up to the front we were brimming with anticipation. We had visited the hotel twice before to swim but not as hotel guests. Upon our arrival I had to flag down someone to assist with our luggage. Initially the guy who assists with calling taxis aided and ultimately we located a bellhop. I always find it a bit of a shocker to have to walk through a metal detector especially one with security officer and his dog. I guess however they are concerned with terrorism and mayhem. So we sauntered through and proceeded to check in. Check in was flawless, quick and professional. We received our room keys with a smile. The room itself was impressive, large, tastefully decorated with a current magazine prominently displayed. The amenities were sufficient for our daily needs.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel but the casino security staff sucked

reviews.text: Hotel Feature Tip : Eventually we decided to do a bit of shopping which began on the first floor Duty Free Shop and ended in the mezzanine area located on the second floor and prepare for a late lunch.We also took advantage of the lovely opportunity for an impromptu photo opt for which the setting was ideal. Finally deciding to eat I had the bright idea of using the hotel ATM machine as opposed to getting the night's cash at the mall (Ayala is right down the road). This was the only sore spot of the evening, though momentary and fleeting. The ground floor ATM was off limits I was informed by a staffer due to an event (wedding) with the second located in PAGCOR (second floor). I was refused entry due to wearing a sleeveless shirt despite informing security of my sole desire to use the ATM. Discussion with the security officer and his supervisor was met with polite but firm refusal. Getting a tad bit annoyed by there unwillingness to even consider thinking out of the box. I reported this silly rule to the first floor Guest Relations Officer who informed me that a report would be generated to the duty manager and we were allowed to proceed to the event hall
reviews.title: Expensive for what you get... but good band at night. But cannot bring friends back to your room???

reviews.text: I went with a large group for my friends wedding but travelling alone. The foyer is great and seems lively with a live band during the night which made it great to walk through. Didn't manage to get to the casino. The price is very expensive even with breakfast included. There was no free wifi which is a basic standard even for 4 star hotels which this did not offer. I could only get wifi in the main foyer which was again expensive. The only main issue I had was I was out with my female friend coming back to the hotel and the hotel staff stopped me and thought she was a hooker or something. I kept telling them it was my friend locally who would be attending the wedding. This ruined my whole week there as the room was booked for 2 adults and I was the only person staying. Overall I would reccomend the hotel but the incident with the night staff not letting my friend stay dissapointed me :(
reviews.title: Felt ripped off

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'd seen rooms available, so turned up at this hotel without a booking- we were told they were fully booked except for their executive suite at a pricey 280 dollars. So we went to the business lounge, used the computer and booked a standard room for 100 dollars (plus 8 pound for the pc use). When we went back to check in a few minutes later with our booking confirmation, we had the choice of smoking or none smoking rooms, so very suspicious that they had no standard rooms 10 mins earlier.
reviews.title: Needs to be refurbished

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my experience at waterfront hotel cebu city was not very good compared with waterfront casino in mactan , i tried cebu city waterfront for a change ,but big mistake , firstly the traffic ,,all day and night never stops , even though waterfront in mactan is a little further away ,it so much easier to get around , the first thing you will notice going into waterfront cebu city is the security and porters ,no one wants to help you with luggage ,they stand around and just stare ,no smiles ,greeting just stares, the service is poor compared to mactan waterfront ,as well as the buffet breakfast, cold , tasteless, i really expected more from such a big hotel , not to mention the water leaking from the ceiling ,from the airco ,i mean gallons , i would not return to this hotel , i highly recommend waterfront in mactan ,different level of hospitality
reviews.title: never again

reviews.text: We have been going to that Hotel for years now ...Rooms are great ...Staff amazing ...lounge staff the Best ever ! Uno staff amazing with Gemma at the eggs , Angie at the pancakes ( ask her about the guy who took the Chocolate sauce and she will blush ! ) Tin Gaw my second favorite restaurant in Cebu ( Great roast duck ) after Tinder box ...Deserts tastes are poor ..
reviews.title: We will go back if .....

reviews.text: The only issues developing there was for the last 2 years was prostitution in the open ...Wish management will address that . Pimps count their money beside you sitting in the lounge and you can see them directing girls with their mobiles ; our Cebu friends don't want to use the lounge anymore and Lady friends we invited for a drink or a meal were not comfortable ...Their other Bar TREF is the most uncomfortable place to get tipsy and wish that the great staff there stop listening and looking at you all the time ...
reviews.title: It was acceptable.

reviews.text: If you want " GRANDEUR " as you advertise I believe you will have to address those issues ...Lorrine Villafuerte was amazing at our booking time with our requests ...
reviews.title: Good central location and polite staff

reviews.text: Nice place. Airconditioner was quite cold which i liked. the breakfast buffet was okay. Gym was under renovation which was not announced. Brought clothes for the gym which took up luggage space! Wasted. Good pool.
reviews.title: Fast, courteous and friendly service - worth going back

reviews.text: I had the unfortunate circumstance to be booked into this nightmare of a property for two nights on my first visit to Cebu. The price per night was ridiculous and at the time of my booking they only had a twin bed room available. I can tell you as an adult woman who is 6'1" tall, I experienced my greatest nightmare spending time in a twin bed which I have not had a reason to do since I was 17 and that is a while ago.
reviews.title: Not a chance that they could pay me to stay here again

reviews.text: On top of the twin beds, the room looked as though it were decorated last in the 70's with rattan furniture. Rattan? I would rather refer to it as "ratty". The room was dingy and dirty and smelled faintly of cigarette smoke which for one who doesn't smoke is neither pleasant nor enjoyable in any way.
reviews.title: Couldn't wait to leave

reviews.text: To add insult to injury, the air conditioning in the room was not working. A call to the front desk for maintenance assistance yielded no response. They were solidly booked for a convention and I was "lucky" to have this room they replied.
reviews.title: Great hotel, but stingy with their bottle openers

reviews.text: A hot, dirty, smelly hotel room is not my idea of a worthwhile evening spent. To top it all off, the loud casino drove me insane. If I want a casino, I will choose Las Vegas - thank you very much!
reviews.title: Okay hotel.

reviews.text: Overall, one of the biggest nightmare experiences of my travel history. If you go, you'd better not be interested in clean and or any semblance of nice.
reviews.title: So comfy bed

aka: Waterfront Cebu City Hotel And Casino
